lines.text: Marriage is one of those things it's best to get over and done with early in life...
[after a puff on her cigarette holder]

[to George]
Today, a funeral, tomorrow, an engagement party. Life goes on, n'est-pas?

[Approaching her moustached ex-stepson]
Ferdinand, you appear to have something on your lip. It looks like a caterpillar.

[Aside to camera]
I'm never entirely sure if I'm famous or notorious. Someone once said that fame is to live in poverty and end up as a statue. Naturally I prefer to be notorious.
Condolences Mrs. Bradley. A good man.
Is the day for truth. The only exciting thing your father ever did was to divorce me.
Alastair, dear Alastair. There are two things in life you can never do. One, catch a waiter's eye before he's ready to see you. And two, turn back the clock.
I've never cared much for the countryside. To me, it's a soggy sort of place where animals and birds wander about uncooked.
Or *don't* wander about, as the case may be.
My husband's mother marches to the beat of different drum.
My mother has an entire orchestra of her own.
Children disappoint their parents, it's one of the immutable laws of nature. Your son's made an unsuitable match, mine became a lawyer.
